etymology.description: 美(美) (měi, "beautiful") + 术(術) (shù, "skill") = the skill of creating beautiful things -> art
etymology.interpretation: 美(美) (měi, "beautiful") signifies the aesthetic aspect, while 术(術) (shù, "skill") indicates the technical proficiency involved in creating artworks. Together, they reflect the idea of art as both a skill and an expression of beauty.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢美术(我喜歡美術)。
学校开设美术课程(學校開設美術課程)，培养学生创造力(培養學生創造力)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxiào kāishè měishù kèchéng, péiyǎng xuéshēng chuàngzàolì.
examples.english: The school offers art courses, cultivating students' creativity.

examples.chinese: 美术启迪心灵(美術啟迪心靈)，让世界更绚丽(讓世界更絢麗)。
examples.pinyin: Měishù qǐdí xīnlíng, ràng shìjiè gèng xuànlì.
examples.english: Art enlightens the mind, making the world more brilliant.
